website_summaries.verdict: An extremely hardy tool that is one piece of stainless steel.
pros: The grip is ergonomically designed to cushion the fingers and hand comfortably
The manufacturer includes a lifetime warranty
This tool is designed for clay-like soil
cons: we did hear about one or two durability issues

customer_reviews.title: Broken Handle
customer_reviews.text: The handle slid off on the first day of use. I was working in fairly hot weather. It looks like the handle is glued to the shovel shaft... so I'm guessing the adhesive breaks down in hot weather. This definitely seems to be a poor design, as I would expect the manufacturer to test their product in different environmental conditions. I thought I lucked out with a $10 hand shovel rated 4.8, but unfortunately it still performs like a $10 shovel.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Poor design and junk.
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Handle came right off and beneath the grip was plastic. My 5 dollar shovel lasted 10 times longer. Only used this twice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: TIME WILL TELL
customer_reviews.text: I really can’t say much about this trowel. It is still in it Box in the garage. Snow and winter weather. Not gardening season yet.. BUT, I can say why I selected this particular trowel. Choices in walk in stores is limited, and over the years I’ve found these tools rust and don’tcut into the soil as I’d like them to. And the blades loosen in the handles. This trowel has a stainless steel blade and shouldn’t rust, also it is bigger than most other trowels out there. I’m almost 80 and need the tool to do the work, not to have to work the tool. Time will tell if it deserves the 5 star rating I am giving it.
customer_reviews.author: Silly Gilly

customer_reviews.title: 1 year later, this is junk.
customer_reviews.text: 1 Year Update: Loose handle continued to get looser after very light rooftop gardening. A couple days ago while transferring a plant I took a swing at an invasive beetle and the metal shovel went flying out of the handle, over the railing, and landed somewhere on the roof of the next condo building over. Junk. Reduced to 1 star. Original Review: Good sturdy blade and comfortable handle, but the first time I gave it a twist while digging a hole in soft potting soil, the rubber grip twisted around about 25 degrees. Still functions just fine, I just would have expected a secure mounting of the grip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Garden Trowl
customer_reviews.text: WOW if you bend this trowel you are some strong. It is quite sturdy and it really is well built. I found that I needed to sharpen the blade tip area to make it somewhat easier to dig with as the blade is a nice thick stainless steel and can present a problem putting it into the ground if you don't sharpen the rounded end of the trowel. A really great trowel and I am very happy with it after spend a lot of money on flimsy trowels in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Powell

customer_reviews.title: Arrived with part of the handle unattached
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a sturdy trowel, I have not used it yet. I opened the box and the top portion of the handle came unglued. Kind of surprised since most people gave this 5 stars. I don't want to go through the hassle of returning this, so I am going to gorilla glue it back on, and hopefully I don't have problems in the future with the handle twisting off like a few other people on here.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Mowery

customer_reviews.title: Works well for cleaning up after the dog.
customer_reviews.text: We use this for picking up solid dog waste from the lawn. The product has as nice little neck between the blade and the handle, which provides some nice separation, if you can picture what I mean. The blade is much wider than what we previously used. That's good for getting the whole of the dog droppings with one motion. But the blade is not too wide; it easily fits in the dog waste bags we bought on Amazon. I know this product is sold as a gardening tool, not as a dog waste removal tool, but this works much faster and better than the "pooper scooper" that we used to use.
customer_reviews.author: Bob of Westerville

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my gardening housemate. He says it's just what he wanted.
customer_reviews.text: My housemate hasn't used this trowel yet. If he tells me there's anything wrong with it, I will update my post. The trowel is large, but perfectly man-sized. It feels good to hold, but do take note that the handle is not at all padded. Seems wonderfully sturdy. Time and lots of yard work will tell.
customer_reviews.author: @your6Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tool for a lot of digging
customer_reviews.text: Been using this extensively in a trenching project for some new drain pipe -- using a big shovel for the bulk digging, and using this for the detail work. Nice weight, very sturdy, and nice scoop size and shape to move a lot of dirt. Besides using this to move already-loosened dirt, I've been using it to dig 1/2-1" deeper in the hard clay as needed so my 4" pipe will lay flat along its route, and this trowel has worked fine and has just the right contour for this part of the project.
customer_reviews.author: John Wakerly

customer_reviews.title: Amazing trowel
customer_reviews.text: I have been searching for a sturdy reliable trowel and I finally found one! The trowel is very well made. I have put it through the paces and am very pleased. I received an email from the company a day or two after receiving the trowel. Great communication from this company. They just wanted to follow up hoping I was pleased with my purchase. I would definitely buy from this company again.
customer_reviews.author: DJB

customer_reviews.title: Very-well built, but a bit heavy = it just might last.
customer_reviews.text: So while I initially thought that this trowel was far too heavy, I've come to appreciate its sturdiness, as I continue to work it rather hard. But thankfully it's holding up very well, which hopefully it will continue to do for decades = they just don't build them like this any more = highly recommend. If only the blade was a bit narrower, I'd like it even more, as it's not all that easy to use in heavy clay & rocks = a fair amount of horsepower is required to use this thing, in our soil.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Zehler

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I've already used this item many times this summer. it's the best spade I ever bought. I've purchased others over the years and I thought they looked sturdy but were not. This spade shows no sign of weakness, hasn't bent in the least and has a nice grip handle. It's a pleasure to work with good tools.
customer_reviews.author: STEPHEN1

customer_reviews.title: Nice Trowel
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice trowel. Seems very sturdy, and well balanced. It is a bit longer than I'd like, but ok. It is stamped stainless steel, made in China. But it seems well made, the handle is a slightly soft feel, including a thumb indent. At least one comment claims it came with instructions to clean, etc, after every use. Mine did not have any such instructions. Seems like it will last a long time. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: TJ in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: A trowel is useless if it bends the first time it encounters something difficult, and you're not really gardening if that doesn't happen. Finding a trowel that fits easily in the hand, stands up to heavy soil, stubborn roots and the occasional rock, and doesn't weigh so much that your hand is tired after five minutes, isn't easy. This one seems to fit the bill, at least so far. The grip is comfortable and it holds up to work. Having gone through several trowels in recent years that didn't live up to their billing, I hope I can keep this one for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Tollyon

customer_reviews.title: it's a good trowel. we got it specifically to replace a ...
customer_reviews.text: it's a good trowel. we got it specifically to replace a bent one. The only issue we have is that the rubberized handle is wearing down after a few months of weeding, planting, gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Eric B.

customer_reviews.title: Great capacity, and rugged
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I like this trowel. It is clearly sturdy (I'm a little brutal with my tools) and has a great capacity. The only drawback is the metal end of the handle -- unless I pay attention, the way I hold the trowel makes it dig into my hand. But as long as I pay attention, all is fine. I think the end would be better if the metal part curved back, instead of having the acute turn. All in all, I'd recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mugwhamp

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Worth a Few Extra $$$
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best, highest quality hand gardening tool I've used or even seen! - The handle is very comfortable - You would have to be a gorilla or superman to bend or break it! - So far, the Stainless Steel is completely rust resistant - It should easily last a lifetime or two Bottom Line: I Highly Recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Paraglider

customer_reviews.title: Crooked
customer_reviews.text: The welding where the spade attaches to handle is really messy and the spade is crooked. It does not line up correctly with the handle. Of course it is still usable but would not have bought this one in a store.
customer_reviews.author: AirOK 21

customer_reviews.title: Not so rust-resistant
customer_reviews.text: My new trowel was washed with soap and water following use in my planters to dig out soil and make a new plant. It is already showing signs of rust even though I dried it immediately. This is disappointing considering what I paid for it and only used it once. I don't like to give poor ratings but these things should be rust-proof as opposed to rust-resistant.
customer_reviews.author: Stelly

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This feels like a weapon. I live in Maine, where it snows in May. Today I used this to help plant my broccoli and brussel sprouts. I used this over the past week to plant my garden, and I live where it snows in May. It cut through frozen sod, didn't bend or chip on stones, and easily went through all layers of the dirt and clay. I would love to have more tools like this. Easily the best value for the money, and worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Johann Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Every gardener needs a few good trowels.
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. The scoop is the right size. I just wish it were a smart tool and I could locate it with a phone app!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Fine

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a small shovel
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to plant flowers. It worked well in doing so. Did not help me in preparing my taxes however. Grudgingly gave it 5 star howevers.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmah!

customer_reviews.title: Why do you need a headline?  .
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons I love Amazon is that the reviews help me choose an item. So, I am motivated to review my purchases to help others. But I gotta say, this business of having to add a headline is a nuisance. I rarely review an item any more because of it. The trowel was a gift for my granddaughter. It arrived quickly, seems very durable, and she is thrilled with it. I would buy it again, but won't review again.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E Foster

customer_reviews.title: Well made- good grip
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, sturdy tool. It has a comfortable grip that makes working with it a pleasure. It feels like it's part of my hand. Great product. I would recommend this trowel to anyone wanting a good, dependable gardening trowel.
customer_reviews.author: S. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible
customer_reviews.text: They aren't kidding when they say it is bend proof. Maybe Superman could since he could, "bend steel with his bare hands!" (Also more powerful than a locomotive and able to leap tall buildings in a single bound." This is a Super trowel, for sure. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: abricru

customer_reviews.title: Awesome garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: Its one of the best trowels I have ever owned! very solid design and its NOT cheaply made! Great Buy and HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: Aras

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is built tough! I don’t know what happened to these other people who said theirs just broke off, but I literally dug metal objects out of the ground all day with it, and it didn’t budge an inch! Very helpful with my treasure hunting 😜
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: My new trowel, love it.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced mine, with your stainless oversized trowel, very easy to grasp and comfortable in my arthritic fingers. I prefer to do a lot of my gardening with a trowel, the soil is heavy with clay . This tool is strong and so far bend-proof, glad to hear this is from a small business owner and I could help, with my review.
customer_reviews.author: oldlady

customer_reviews.title: Nice garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: I've used this extensively for gardening and repotting plants, and it's very good for those purposes. I even cleaned out a gutter on my house with it as the leaves had been in there so long that they had basically turned into mud.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Seems better than most
customer_reviews.text: I have a habit of buying trowels and then losing them in the garage. I seem to buy them every year and cannot find a single one in the spring. This one seems better than most, sturdy and easy to use. I wonder if it will go live with its missing siblings...
customer_reviews.author: Koi Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty!
customer_reviews.text: Love the sturdiness of the trowels. We have clay soil and it does not bend nor break. Length is just right. Well done.
customer_reviews.author: Punky

customer_reviews.title: Now this is a real garden trowel!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this trowel to replace my broken one. They seem to break at the handle connection to the scoop. This trowel has a nice solid weld that should hold up to the pressure. So far I have used it in Georgia clay with no problems. In fact the scoop has a sharp edge so cuts into the ground well. Handle is the most comfortable cushion grip around. I highly recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Solid Garden Trowel
customer_reviews.text: My spouse is an active gardener in South Florida and roots, etc. spread rapidly so it is important to have a solidly built trowel. Those stocked in big box stores have been cheapened down. Glad we found this on Amazon. So far this looks promising and we especially like the warranty that we hope we won't have to use.
customer_reviews.author: BocaBuyer

customer_reviews.title: The grip was comfortable and the heavy blade made a very difficult job ...
customer_reviews.text: A sprinkler feed pipe leak required me to expose it by digging through several inches of hard pan clay. The trowel was more than up to the task. It not only worked through the hard pan well, it also did not cause my hand holding to hurt. The grip was comfortable and the heavy blade made a very difficult job fairly easy.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kindel

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tool!
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is extra sturdy and a reliable tool to use for digging. I anticipate that it will last me a good long while. I also like that it has a warranty, but it is made so well that I doubt that I will have to use it!
customer_reviews.author: Peetee

customer_reviews.title: Did NOT Bend!
customer_reviews.text: I maintain my yard myself. Always weeding, planting, moving something! I have owned several trowels that were more expensive but were a disappointment some actually breaking, others bending! So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: S Wenner

customer_reviews.title: One of the best on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid, well made tool for the man or woman who appreciates quality craftsmanship and longevity in what they buy. I assure you, you won't be disappointed with this product. It will last you a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Beantown Bob

customer_reviews.title: Seems quite sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this spade, for a few weeks now, in the garden. (Gardening is year round in So-Cal.) It seems well made, and I expect it to last for several years. Very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Kerr

customer_reviews.title: IF U want the Best
customer_reviews.text: After 45 yrs of gardening. The best quality and am sure it will last forever if it doesn't get taken away from me by a neighbor. The size is large and really for a mans use. But if a woman uses two hands, it will work just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Gunnard Hedwall

customer_reviews.title: Let's call a spade a spade
customer_reviews.text: Can't be the first person to make that joke, but this garden spade is great. It's slightly larger than others I've used before which I think is an advantage, makes digging holes in our garden for small plants or bulbs a little easier.
customer_reviews.author: xiaojuan zheng

customer_reviews.title: Still strong even if dropped in fire.
customer_reviews.text: Holds up good, if accidentally lost in a huge leaf pile by a 3yr old and said pile then is burned, shovel holds up except the rubber part. So now my 3yr old has a shovel to play in the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: I am delighted with my new trowel
customer_reviews.text: I am delighted with my new trowel! My other one finally fell apart after decades of use. This one should last the rest of my lifetime! It is indeed heavy duty. The large handle is very comfortable for my arthritic hands. The angle is wonderful and it is large enough to get in and really dig when necessary. I would highly recommend this trowel if you like to dig in the dirt like I do. A gardener's delight!
customer_reviews.author: Connie W.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and heavy
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is super sturdy! This is great, but it is also extremely heavy. I decided to return it, cause it's too heavy for me and makes working in soil even more exhausting.
customer_reviews.author: SebastianT

customer_reviews.title: Rating an item like this . . .
customer_reviews.text: Rating an item like this seems very premature. You should be asking after at least one gardening season.
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: it's a very sturdy garden tool. I have used if almost everyday for the last 2 weeks. It is wide and I can shovel more dirt out of my garden. So far, it's very reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Grand

customer_reviews.title: I was immediately impressed with how sturdy it is
customer_reviews.text: Just used this trowel for the first time yesterday as it is just beginning to be gardening season where we live. I was immediately impressed with how sturdy it is. I think I am going to like it very well. Believe me, I have bent plenty of trowels and it will be refreshing to have one that keeps its shape.
customer_reviews.author: Joe O

customer_reviews.title: May be the finest trowel you ever own!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I Garden a lot. The soil in our area is compacted clay. as a result, we tend to go through trowels in a matter of days; but not any more. Though we haven't run over it with the truck (yet?), we have put this trowel through all of our toughest jobs. We recommend this Trowel to everyone. We can't bend it. It doesn't rust. It will cut through the toughest growth.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon

customer_reviews.title: given as a gift
customer_reviews.text: I had 2 gave one to my daughter and one to her friend, she works in his garden. they both think the trowls are great and very sturdy, pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Great Garden Tool
customer_reviews.text: This a well built tool that should last for many years. I love that it is stainless steel and will not rust like other cheapo trowels I have purchased in the past. The handle is very comfortable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Ringo

customer_reviews.title: Very Good
customer_reviews.text: I had a few trowels and when I started getting more serious about gardening this year I managed to snap 3 of them. Oops. Ordered this and it's held up to my gardening frenzy.
customer_reviews.author: Whisper

customer_reviews.title: Solid and sturdy tool.
customer_reviews.text: My recent purchase was a gift for my daughter when I bent her old trowel. I've owned one myself for about a year and it has never failed to dig out what I'm after and is the first trowel I've owned that won't bend when you dig in the clay soils in the Northwest.
customer_reviews.author: John May

customer_reviews.title: Well built and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I got the Garden Trowel because I only had a rake and I needed to be able to handle gravel and dirt digging in our yard. The Trowel is well built and perfect fir this type of work. It is made out of stainless steel, so I hope it won't rust, but only time will tell. I haven't bought a trowel in 10 years, so if it lasts that long, I will be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Gadener

customer_reviews.title: A serious tool for seriously tough planting conditions
customer_reviews.text: I live in Colorado, where we have "outdoor" modeling clay and rock instead of soil to work with (it's not as fun as regular modeling clay). I have broken garden augurs trying to dig holes for plants and my former (now deceased) trowel is so bent it doesn't hold dirt. So far the Edward Tools trowel is doing the task just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Roo

customer_reviews.title: SuperMax Towel
customer_reviews.text: This is one solid too !! I'm so tired of getting cheap crap advertised as quality and get a POS. This one is a real keeper. Don't hesitate, it is quality and I'm sure it will last thru the toughest conditions the average gardener will encounter. Good welds, tough steel and great handle. at 73, I'll never need another !
customer_reviews.author: TK

customer_reviews.title: We designed & made
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other models, this is made of durable stainless and parts are solidly soldered. Though some may find it a bit heavy or too big, this is a tool made to last and be used in a serious gardening. The handle is ergonomically shaped and "rubberized" to be quite comfortable. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: busterdog

customer_reviews.title: Great trowel!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, comfortable to hold and use, and has held up very well so far, even though I usually keep it sticking out of a damp compost pile.
customer_reviews.author: Verre

customer_reviews.title: Very reasonably priced - perfect size
customer_reviews.text: I use the product for digging up iris bulbs to transplant to other parts of the garden. It is very sturdy - a bit bigger than trowels I have had in the past which is a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Jean B. Zietz

customer_reviews.title: Works! And won't break
customer_reviews.text: Great tool sturdy and well balanced, does the job without bending!I was tired of constantly buying new garden trowels because I always seem to bend them ,I love this tool
customer_reviews.author: colter

customer_reviews.title: Great very sturdy tool. Husband very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: After using a cheap plastic garden tool, my husband said to get something sturdy that doesn’t bend. This fit that description. It was a great price for what you get. We HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!
customer_reviews.author: Bluebird

customer_reviews.title: solid shovel
customer_reviews.text: This is one tough tool. I have used it to dig through the hardest clay and dirt... sparing no force to break through the sod. It holds up perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Doc Dawn

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend this trowel.
customer_reviews.text: This trowel is very well made and easy to hold. It has stood up to digging clay soil and hitting rocks. I'm sure I won't have to ever buy another one (unless I lose it)
customer_reviews.author: Lindy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice trowel
customer_reviews.text: Really nice trowel; feels good in my hand, perfect size - not too big or small, and made very sturdily. Was delivered quickly and in perfect shape. I think this trowel is going to be with us for many gardening seasons to come. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gardening tool
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy messing around in the ground as well as in my potted plants. I am not someone I would consider as being particularly strong, but I do manage to bend other tools. Not this one, though!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Sutter

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is a trowel for gardening. I use it to propagate bulbs. These are really robust, study trowels-stainless steel and welded with a durable handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy handheld shovels
customer_reviews.text: I was tire of buying hand held shovels that break on the first use. These shovels are so sturdy. I use them for digging out my sprinkler pipe and planting flowers. Love them. Very heavy duty
customer_reviews.author: Cherie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This is somewhat larger and heavier than I expected, which is great. Seems to be extremely sturdy and well made as well. Haven’t used it yet, as this is winter now, but I’m sure the blade will not bend from the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Lori C.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy tool! I think this will outlive me! Glad I made the purchase. The scoop is bigger/wider than I expected but that is not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: P & J King

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: A man’s trowel. Very sturdy. I think I have bent every trowel I have bought over the last 40 years this one just might stand up to yardwork
customer_reviews.author: Lake Oz

customer_reviews.title: Heavy-duty, as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a heavy-duty trowel to replace a trowel that just snapped in the middle of the handle, and this one appears to be very sturdy. Of course, I haven't put it through its paces over several gardening seasons yet, but it looks promising. It's also nice to have the hanging ring on the handle, an unexpected handy feature. I wouldn't mind having a matching narrow-blade transplanter.
customer_reviews.author: O. Susana

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomic, Functional and Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a trowel to replace a an older tool that I somehow lost. This one ie better. The hand his ergonomic. And the trowel is a bit wider. It is my new favorite tool and one I use every time I work in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Ziggy the Foodie

customer_reviews.title: A great garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: I'm a big guy and I put a lot of weight onto this trowel (hard soil) and it did not bend.....not like the usual stamped steel trowel which usually folds quickly. Stainless steel too! Comfortable handle. If you need a trowel - buy this!
customer_reviews.author: Double Ott Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Quality Garden Trowel
customer_reviews.text: This is the best garden trowel I have ever had. It should last me many years. I am truly impressed with this product and how well-made it it.
customer_reviews.author: Deb B

customer_reviews.title: Great Trowel
customer_reviews.text: Although I have not had a chance to use the Trowel, I can see that it is very strong and will help me in my hobby of rock hunting. I really do like it's look and durability. The handel is extremely well built too.
customer_reviews.author: George Broughton

customer_reviews.title: The blade is wide and the handle is shaped and padded so it is comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: The trowel is exactly what I was looking for to work in my yard. The blade is wide and the handle is shaped and padded so it is comfortable to hold. It is very well made and and will be strong enough for all my needs. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: David McDonough

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy hand trowel.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made hand trowel. It was much more sturdy than I was expecting and I expect it to last for a good number of years.
customer_reviews.author: C.Collett

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well constructed tool. Easy to use, a little larger than expected, seems durable. Prompt shipping by seller.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Chance

customer_reviews.title: Professional Grade
customer_reviews.text: This garden trowel is the best, very sturdy and easy to hold and use. I don't see myself needing to purchase another one (I actually bought 2!) for quite some time!
customer_reviews.author: Brad T

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a garden trowel that doesn't bend.
customer_reviews.text: I have had numerous garden trowels in my years, but none were as tough as this one. All of them would bend or just flat out break. I have used this new trowel for multiple times now on some pretty tough soil and it has worked like a charm. I may just go out and buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: ingeborgdot

customer_reviews.title: Nice trowel.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a sturdy trowel as my last one just broke in half. I do put them through a lot of work. This one seems great. Good quality, nice feel. I love my garden tools!
customer_reviews.author: Sabre Jet

customer_reviews.title: Solid shovel.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a shovel that bent beyond repair, and was particularly looking for something sturdier made from better quality materials. This baby hit the mark, and is a beast. Nice heavyweight metal. I’m confident the shovel will take a beating, and keep coming back for more many seasons from now.
customer_reviews.author: Bass Doc

customer_reviews.title: Excellent heavy duty garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: These garden towels are very well made. I have used them to remove largesse in very hard, rocky soil with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S.

customer_reviews.title: I  really "dig" it!
customer_reviews.text: I have a large garden and have used this shovel a lot since I got it. So far it has been up to the task. Strong, comfortable handle, should last awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Gopher Man

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy as Advertized
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it that much yet, but it feels a lot better than the five trowels I have in various broken states.
customer_reviews.author: RJMHRT

customer_reviews.title: Garden Trowel is Superior 2020
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the best garden trowel that I have bought in the last 20 years. It is sturdy, not like most of them. 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Sumerford

customer_reviews.title: This could quite possibly be the greatest garden trowel ever!
customer_reviews.text: This could quite possibly be the greatest garden trowel ever! So sturdy and feels really comfortable to hold. It's a lot bigger than my previous garden trowel so I wasn't sure I was going to like it. Now I don't know how I gardened without it!!
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to damage this tool. Works great in our clay soil and it has shown no corrosion so far.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond A. Homewood

customer_reviews.title: best trowel ever
customer_reviews.text: I've been through a lot of trowels in my lifetime but this one is the best I've ever owned. thank you for making " The Trowel! vern
customer_reviews.author: vern

customer_reviews.title: Extremely sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely sturdy trowel. My former one would bend fairly easily if the wet soil was too heavy, for example and I would have to adjust what I was doing. I won't worry about that with this one!
customer_reviews.author: KimR

customer_reviews.title: Great shovel
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't take this for a test-dig yet, I can see and feel this is going to be a keeper among my garden tools.
customer_reviews.author: carwash

customer_reviews.title: Solid, Sturdy Trowel
customer_reviews.text: A very solid, sturdy garden trowel that hasn't even shown any signs of bending after a month of use. Looks like a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: RAF

customer_reviews.title: Strong, won’t bend in tough soil
customer_reviews.text: This shovel is well worth the money. So sturdy, does not bend like other shovels I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Sciria

customer_reviews.title: it works
customer_reviews.text: It is different than the one I had before. This one doesn't have the ring pictured to hang it, the handle hole is too small to hang on some hooks.
customer_reviews.author: KrK

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and solid
customer_reviews.text: This hand shovel is larger than average, has a nice sharp edge, and most importantly to me, feels very sturdy. I have several shovels that have bent at the tip or the neck and just generally feel like they will give under the slightest pressure. This one seems to be doing the job well so far!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Sides

customer_reviews.title: Does notbreak
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a trowel that wont break. So far, so good! Most bend in the first couple weeks, but thos is strong. The handle is comfy, too. I dont have large hands and sometimes wish it was a bit smaller, but I am overall very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Amber Plucknett

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, no bending despite my being strong and using it hard. Quite big but I have large hands. My wife liked it too, and it performed far better than many of our other products
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: after 400 daffodil bulbs ready for the next 500
customer_reviews.text: Good trowel. Used it to plant 400 daff bulbs, some hyacinths as well. Still in excellent condition. Sturdy, sharp, easy to use On to the next 500 bulbs
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Smith

customer_reviews.title: Garden trowel
customer_reviews.text: Love it ! Very sturdy and comfortable to hold . I Would recommend this to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Awesome2u

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Gardening Tool!
customer_reviews.text: This Garden Trowel is very durable and well made. I love gardening with this durable tool!
customer_reviews.author: Lesley J. Melahn

customer_reviews.title: strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: After looking a small shovels to use for trenching a tent on a campsite, I bought this garden trowel instead. It is strong and sturdy, well designed and comfortable to hold. It did all that it should at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Laquintano

customer_reviews.title: Nicely weighted and feels strong in the hand
customer_reviews.text: I have not actually used this trowel yet, but it feels and looks strong and well-made. I am very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

product_meta.title: Edward Tools Bend-Proof Garden Trowel - Heavy Duty Polished Stainless Steel - Rust Resistant Oversized Garden Hand Shovel for Quicker Work - Digs Through Rocky/Heavy soils - Comfort Grip (1)
product_meta.description: Item Package Quantity:1Edward Tools Bend-proof Garden Trowel is the most heavy duty garden trowel on the market. The one piece stainless steel design is bend proof making it the best trowel for digging in rocky or heavy clay soils. An oversized trowel head makes for quicker work as you can move soil much more quickly. The ergonomically designed handle reduces hand fatigue with soft rubber contoured finger grips and palm rest. Edward Tools Bend-proof Garden Trowel comes with a lifetime warranty.
feature_bullets: Most heavy duty garden hand trowel tool on the market
One piece stainless steel is bend proof making it the best hand shovel for working rocky or heavy clay soils
Oversize trowel head makes for quicker work as soil can be moved in greater volume
Ergonomic rubber grip with contoured finger grips and palm rest
Lifetime warranty - Find a way to bend this garden hand shovel and we will replace it no questions asked
